post_text: 19 years ago, a generation watched as the second plane hit and watched as people in sheer desperation jumped to escape the catastrophic explosion, fire, and collapse of the World Trade Towers. As the days, weeks, and months continued we heard and witnessed acts of bravery from people trying to assist the wounded, find the lost, and comfort the grieving. It’s hard to comprehend even though we witnessed it, but it’s even harder for our K-12 students (who were not born yet) to find relevance. That is why, today, on Patriot Day, we honor the 2,977 people who were killed and the 6,000+ that were injured during the September 11, 2001 attacks on the United States; our World Trade Center and Pentagon. These attacks were the most devastating foreign attack on US land since Pearl Harbor (1941). #neverforget #history #alwaysremember #PatriotDay #teach #isd345

Our school district is currently facing some tough financial issues so we are proactively working with community members to address those issues head on. We’ve had great successes in recent years including very strong state standardized test scores and increased enrollment, but we are facing challenges like the inability to provide 21st century education opportunities and adequate student technology as well as holding a fund balance (savings account) much lower than it should be. Within two years, our district will have a structural deficit resulting in the need for significant budget reductions.
These reductions will result;
- higher class sizes
- reduced program opportunities
The district is working to avoid these consequences. To Read More About Our Financial Future follow this link: https://www.nls.k12.mn.us/securefinancialfuture

This event will take place on Tuesday, April 21st, from noon to 3pm at the YMCA (1000 Lakeland Dr SE, Willmar). One box of produce will be provided to the first 500 households at no cost.

Our Speech team would like to invite students, staff, administration, and our community to join us at our upcoming Speech meets to see what all the buzz is about! Subsections is approaching on March 26 and will be held at BBE. This weekend they are off to Milaca and the weekend after that, they compete at Melrose.

Here are the results from Dassel-Cokato meet on March 7th.
NLS placed 1st in Medium Team (14 students attended) category.
Individuals (3 rounds and finals):
Taylor Barber took Category Champion in Creative Expression and Prose Reading (1st place)
Ben Wehseler took Category Champion in Poetry Reading (1st place)
Ally Straub took Category Champion in Informative Speaking (1st place)
Jackson Barber took 2nd place in Humorous Interpretation
April Groff took 3rd place in Humorous Interpretation
Maddie Schiller took 3rd place in Dramatic Interpretation
Andrew Straub took 4th place in Informative Speaking
Jasper Nordin took 5th place in Original Oratory
